data_table.description: Form 151 - Activities of Daily Life -- current experiences, i.e., general health and quality of life, subject's typical day's activies and if health limits those activities, and ability to perform routine activities. Note: The rel# in the file name is used by the submitter to track embargo releases. Files that have "rel2" or later may either contain additional variables or more recent data as compared to the previous rel#.

variable.name: F151VY
variable.comment: Visit year for which this form was collected

variable.name: F151DAYS
variable.description: F151 Days since randomization or enrollment

variable.name: GENHEL
variable.comment: In general, would you say your health is: (Mark one circle only.)

variable.name: LIFEQUAL
variable.comment: Overall, how would you rate your quality of life? (Mark one circle below.)

variable.name: SPECSERV
variable.comment: Does the place (home, apartment, assisted living facility) where you live have special services for older people (such as help with transportation, meals, medicines, or bathing)?

variable.name: RECVSERV
variable.comment: Are you currently receving any of these services? Sub-question of F151 V9 Q3 'Special services where living'

variable.name: NURSHOME
variable.description: In past year, stayed in a nursing home
variable.comment: In the past year, have you stayed in a nursing home?

variable.name: WALKAID
variable.description: Aid to walk on a level surface
variable.comment: What aid, if any, do you usually use to walk on a level surface? (Mark one.)
variable.value: I do not use any aid

variable.name: CALCIUM
variable.comment: Are you taking a calcium supplement such as Oscal, Viactiv, or Tums? Not collected on all versions of Form 151.

variable.name: VIGACT
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, or strenuous sports

variable.name: MODACT
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Moderate activities, such as moving a table, vacuuming, bowling, or golfing

variable.name: LIFTGROC
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Lifting or carrying groceries

variable.name: STAIRS
variable.description: Limited climbing several flights of stairs
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Climbing several flights of stairs

variable.name: STAIR
variable.description: Limited climbing one flight of stairs
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Climbing one flight of stairs

variable.name: BENDING
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Bending, kneeling, stooping

variable.name: WALK1M
variable.description: Limited walking more than one mile
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Walking more than a mile

variable.name: WALKBLKS
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Walking several blocks

variable.name: WALK1BLK
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Walking one block

variable.name: BATHING
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one circle for each question.) Bathing or dressing yourself

variable.name: FEEDSELF
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each question.) Can you feed yourself?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: DRESS
variable.description: Can you dress and undress yourself
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each question.) Can you dress and undress yourself?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: INOUTBED
variable.description: Can you get in and out of bed yourself
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each question.) Can you get in and out of bed yourself?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: SHOWER
variable.description: Can you take a bath or shower
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each question.) Can you take a bath or shower?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: GROCSHOP
variable.description: Can you do your own grocery shopping
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each question.) Can you do your own grocery shopping?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: TAKEMEDS
variable.description: Can you keep track of and take your medicines
variable.comment: These next questions ask about how much help (if any) you need to do routine activities for yourself. Help can be defined as getting assistance from another person or using a device. (Mark one circle for each question.) Can you keep track of and take your medicines?
variable.value: Completely unable to do this by myself

variable.name: ACTDLY
variable.comment: Computed from Form 151, questions 17-20. Source: WHI BAC. Four items describing basic activities (whether can feed yourself, dress, get in and out of bed, and take a bath) each of which has three possible values (1=without help, 2=some help, 3=completely unable) are summed. A lower score indicates greater ability to cope with daily living activities. Missing if any of the four items are missing.

variable.name: PHYSFUN
variable.comment: Computed from Form 151, questions 6-15. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on physical functioning. PHYSFUN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.
